name: Hampton Inn & Suites Atlanta/Duluth/Gwinnett County

reviews.text: excellent staff that could not be more helpful, we enjoyed staying at this Hampton, although much of what is offered is standard to the hampton brand the staff were extra special. If we were going this way again we would definoitely stay at this hotel again, and would recommend it
reviews.title: Family stay

reviews.text: I spent three nights here for business. My colleague and I arrived on Saturday night about 7, took our luggage out of the rental car trunk, and the trunk refused to close, sticking straight up. We tried to shut it a number of times, then went into register and call the rental company. Ebony at the front desk told me to move it under the canopy for safety so she could see it on cctv. When I moved it she came out with the maintenance man and they looked at it while I was in an endless computer loop for emergency assistance with the rental. He poked at the latch with a screw driver, but she problem-solved, noticing that the gasket had pulled slightly away from the rim, pushed it back in and, Voila! the trunk closed. She went above and beyond. Otherwise the staff were friendly, rooms clean, breakfast ample. The parking lot and area were beautiful and convenient to work in Norcross area and a number of restaurants.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, especially Ebony

reviews.text: The Hampton Inn was a nice clean room for a good value. I was pleased with the our experience. My only complaint is that it is a little hard to find. You would not know it was there. It did not have a sign visible from the main street.
reviews.title: Good Value for a cleam room
Good hotel for location
reviews.text: The common areas were clean and the staff was friendly. I loved the fact that is was off of the main strip. No highway noise.

If you need to stay in Duluth this Hampton Inn is fairly new, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was really good - cheesy eggs and waffles. My king room had a fridge and a nice desk. My stay was for business.
reviews.title: A nice hotel.

reviews.text: As others have noted, yes, this is an older property. And the furnishings are dated. But, big deal, right? If it still works and is clean, I'm not going to advocate for everything to get tossed in the dump just because it is old-fashioned.
reviews.title: Needs Improvements in Cleanliness Standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, I do take issue when the property isn't particularly clean, or, when the staff may be lacking some training in maintaining levels of cleanliness.
reviews.title: much cheaper than all hotel in the area

reviews.text: The entire property suffers from high humidity -- so much so that my work papers curled, and, my socks got damp just from walking in the room.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I also had roaches in my room. Not palmetto bugs, which can't be helped in the south. I had German roaches. To be fair - hotel staff was disgusted and embarrassed by the roaches thing and did try to make the situation right.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: But with an overall-damp property that seems to have lax standards on how to maintain cleanliness (I saw two breaches of cleanliness standards during my 2 nights here) makes me think I won't be returning to this Hampton again.
reviews.title: Stayed for Business Travel

reviews.text: I generally stay at Hilton properties.
reviews.title: Business Trip

reviews.text: One thing that I like about Hampton Inn's is that they are generally consistent across the US. This location was no different - as expected.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, Good Breakfast

reviews.text: I arrived around 11am and my room was not ready yet (they were full the evening before). The desk agent took my number and called me when my room was ready.
reviews.title: Hampton

reviews.text: The front desk staff was great. Had a two night business stay at the beginning of July. We were upgraded immediately upon check in & the front desk clerk went above and beyond in helping me with a laundry issue. I had a sunscreen explosion in the luggage & there was a traveling baseball team with what seemed like 100s of uniforms clogging up the laundry facilities- but I was assisted nicely by the front desk going above and beyond. The room was a standard room with fridge & microwave. Both were clean, although the fridge wasn't particularly cold. The bathroom was clean and the towels were soft. The water was hot & plentiful although the water pressure was not the most spectacular. There were cookies at the front desk most of the evening, although the cadre of teenage baseball players kept the staff busy trying to keep cookies stocked. The breakfast was better than most with plenty of protein options and a change in selection from one day to the next. I don't recommend the hard boiled eggs, but the other items were acceptable. All in all, this is a great little business hotel with a friendly staff, edible breakfast, clean facilities and free wi-fi. It is not a resort with a fancy spa and five star dining. If that is what you are looking for, go elsewhere.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: Overall a excellent stay. Could improve on one thing. As a business traveler, I need more accessable electrical outlets (Table, by the bed, etc). Most hotels have on light switch, etc. Hamton hotel is my peffered choice of hotels and I'm use to seeing more electrical outlets. All in all, they were very consistent in Hamtons class and service.
reviews.title: Terrible smell through out the entire hotel

reviews.text: Just like most Hampton Inns, this one was very clean and well managed. The employees were polite and the breakfast was perfect. The best part was the price! For a two room suite with a FULL kitchen it was only $93 a night. We stayed two nights and I plan on using this Hampton Inn again.
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.text: Located in a quite, well cared for community. Easy in/out location to interstate. Rooms and lobby very clean. The staff was courteous and helpful with questions and advise. Excellent complimentary breakfast.
reviews.title: Great all around hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed twice at this location. Last time the TV kept coming on at all hours in the night. Now this time, the toilet flushing system was the NOISIEST ever had in any hotel. Bye-bye to good night sleep! Could hear other rooms flushings.
reviews.title: Celebration of life

reviews.text: I have been staying in Hilton Hotel Chains all over the world since 1967. I designed conference chairs for Nicky Hilton in a Hilton Hotel in Houston ˇTexas in 1974. He gave me a special Hilton card that allowed me to always have a room anywhere I traveled. Wish I had another one.
reviews.title: Hampton Experience

reviews.text: As the other reviews stated, this hotel is dated, a few new updates, but the carpets, walls, and most furniture has been used hard. Sliding door in my suite was not easy to track, and the handle and lock were not working. If I had discovered earlier in the night before settling in, I would have requested a transfer. Luckily, the balcony is secluded and was on a high floor. Bathroom was a bit cramped for a suite, and the bathroom door had to be shut to access the toilet. Water pressure was a bit miserable in AM.
reviews.title: Worked for a night

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Atlanta/Duluth/Gwinnett County Hotel
